basics.name: Jozef William Dransfield
basics.label: Agile Senior Developer
basics.summary: Product-Focused Software Engineer with a proven track record of navigating the full application stack to deliver business-critical tools. Polyglot by nature, I thrive in fast-paced environments where Agile practices drive quality and speed. I pride myself on being a `bridge` between tech and business, adept at translating stakeholder requirements into robust code while maintaining a relentless focus on the end-user experience.

work.name: HSBC
work.summary:
- Collaborated with teams across the globe to deliver a system to provide quotes to an external vendor. 
 - Spearheaded a custom functional and monitoring toolkit that identified bottlenecks pre-launch, ensuring 100% stability during the go-live phase.

work.name: CitiBank (through Juxt)
work.summary:
- Modernized legacy data system by replacing a high-scale key-value database with a scalable microservices suite deployed via Kubernetes. 
 - Eliminated long-standing technical debt by migrating time-dependent legacy systems to a cloud-native internal banking platform, all while growth on the existing platform was continuing to grow.

work.name: HSBC (through TekSystems)
work.summary: Expanded the Prime Brokerage platformâ€™s capabilities to support U.S. Arranged Financing, enabling the business to capture new market share within North American jurisdictions.

work.name: Delta Capita
work.summary: Engineered a library of shared services and UI components, enabling rapid prototyping and reducing development cycles for new client requirements.
highlights: Serverless Message Driven architecture (Amazon Lambda, Amazon SQS)
S3 immutable storage for business data.
Angular / React monorepo using nx.js to combine the components into one platform user interface.
NodeJS express apps that function as the lambda code

work.name: Credit Suisse
work.summary: Developed the workflow based structured product lifecycle orchestration app using Flowable from scratch. (BPMN)
highlights: Provided the orchestration that tied the individual micro services into a system for documenting, costing and selling structued products.
Built the new system product store for capturing product state.
Pushing forward with new ways to test and coordinate microservices within our group.
Pushing forward with new ways to orchestrate our deployments with our group.
Maintaining existing structured product software solutions
